attributes.action: Require university nursing students to study in classroom based for 20/21
attributes.additional_details:
The quality of online lectures is not equal to face-to-face lectures. Online lectures is difficult most of the time, having bad connection and cannot fit big classes of 260+ in one online meeting. Most people isn't able to access due to the online room meeting reached its capacity. 
It is not fair for only nursing students to mostly study online and other students on other courses is allowed to study classroom based.
attributes.background: Nursing students not allowed to have classroom based lectures unlike other university students courses.

rejection.details:
Deciding how to deliver university courses in line with current restrictions and Government advice is a matter for individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons.

If you want to complain about how your university is delivering a course you can read the Office for Student's guidance on making a complaint here: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/contact/complaints-and-notifications/making-a-complaint-to-a-higher-education-provider/
